title: Front Fork - Installation

body.body: Position the indicator clamp between the upper and lower yoke.
Position the clutch cable guide between the indicator clamp and the upper yoke.
Install each fork through the lower yoke, and slide the direction indicator clamps on to the forks.
Position the forks through the lower yoke,
28.5 mm from lower edge of top yoke to the flat portion of the fork top cap.
Tighten the lower yoke pinch bolts to
If the fork top caps have been loosened, tighten them to
Tighten the upper yoke clamp bolts to

Move the handlebars to the left and right full lock while checking that cables and harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.
Position the top edge of the cable guide 70 mm below the lower edge of the upper yoke. With the cable guide in the same orientation as noted for removal, tighten its fixing to
. Ensure the clutch cable, and its rubbing strip, is routed through the cable guide.
Clutch cable guide distance from upper yoke 70 mm
Position the direction indicators as noted for removal and tighten its fixing to
Position the top of the fork gaiter to the lower edge of lower yoke and tighten the clip to
. Ensure that the fixing head for the clip is facing forward and is positioned as shown in the following illustration.
Route the ABS wheel speed sensor harness as noted for removal and fit the wheel speed sensor and shim(s) to the fork leg. Tighten the fixing to
The air gap between the ABS pulser ring and the sensor must be between 0.40 mm and 1.20 mm. Check, and if necessary, adjust the air gap (see
Lower the motorcycle to the ground and park it on the side stand.
